Summary




    AC Transit is currently seeking candidates for the position of Statistical Data and Information Analyst. Under general supervision, this position, collects, maintains, synthesizes, and analyzes data from numerous sources; initiates studies; presents results to a wide variety of audiences; and acts as a resource to other departments for the development of methodologies and statistically valid reports.
    This is an excellent opportunity to work for the largest bus agency in California, make a difference in our local community, and promote AC Transit as a great employer of the East Bay. In addition to working with some of the best in the business, AC Transit also has an excellent benefits package that includes pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, and 457 savings plan.
  


Representative Functions




Collects, maintains, analyzes, and assists in the interpretation of service and performance data from a wide variety of internal District databases and software systems, as well as external sources.
Conducts research; and designs and develops technical studies involving operational, performance, or financial data and information, in cooperation with various District departments.
Designs and develops research designs and methodologies, data collection instruments, protocols for coding and tabulation, and reporting standards to ensure the accurate collection, analysis, and interpretation of data.
Designs, develops, and presents reports and presentations that include narrative written analysis, statistical summaries, tables, and other graphic representations of data.
Maintains, tests, and verifies the integrity of data by identifying and resolving problems with data files and software interfaces.
Provides consulting services to other District departments; and consults with external organizations to gather data and information, and to provide data analysis and interpretation.
Travels locally to other District facilities, and may supervise or perform field studies within the AC Transit District.
May supervise and/or provide work direction to District personnel conducting surveys, or otherwise engaged in the collection and tabulation of data.
Provides data, information, and analysis for the development of District policies, procedures, and standards.
Provides analysis and interpretation of non-statistical information.
Performs related duties as required.




Minimum Qualifications




Education: A Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Business Administration, Marketing Research, Economics, Industrial-Organizational Psychology, Social Sciences, or a similar field that included extensive coursework in statistical analysis.  Experience: Five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in the statistical analysis and interpretation of data and information; including verifiable experience with databases, as well as the reporting and presentation of data to a wide variety of audiences.
     Special Requirement: Must be willing to: (1) work outside regular business hours as required by implementation of special projects, and emergencies; and (2) travel between the various District facilities as required.  Desirable Skills:

Previous experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, Business Analyst or Data Analyst
Previous experience with coding, R Python, GIS, data modeling, SPSS, or similar coding processes
Previous experience with SQL, Database Environments, pulling data, creating BI Dashboards, and telling the business story using data-driven insights
Previous experience with Power BI, Tableau, and/or other Open Source tools




Additional Information


Physical Requirements: (1) Must maintain the physical condition necessary to perform tasks in an office setting operating a personal computer, keyboards, and other peripheral equipment. (2) Must maintain the mobility necessary to perform fieldwork at locations within the AC Transit District.

 THIS POSITION IS A UNION POSITION, REPRESENTED BY AFSCME

    CoinFlip is a global digital currency platform company, focused on providing consumers simple and secure access to buy and sell cryptocurrency. The company operates the world's largest network of cryptocurrency kiosks by transaction volume with more than 5,000 kiosks across 49 U.S. states, Puerto Rico, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Italy, Panama, and Brazil. CoinFlip’s digital currency kiosks make buying and selling major cryptocurrencies accessible and safe for consumers who wish to purchase their digital currency using cash. CoinFlip also operates CoinFlip Preferred, a personalized over-the-counter service that provides investors with custom, white glove support for their cryptocurrency transactions. In 2022, CoinFlip launched CoinFlip Ventures, an investment group offering coaching, funding, and networking support to early-stage crypto and web3 projects.
   


    CoinFlip was founded in 2015 by Daniel Polotsky, Kris Dayrit, Alan Gurevich, and Ben Weiss. Headquartered in Chicago, CoinFlip placed in the top 500 on the 2021, 2022, and 2023 Inc. 5000 list, and on the 2022 and 2023 Deloitte Technology Fast 500, was named the 2021 and 2022 #1 fastest-growing company in Chicago by Crain's, ranked in Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces in 2021 and 2022, and was awarded the 2021 and 2022 Stevie ® Awards for Customer Service.     We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. This role will work closely with Business Functions, Product, Marketing and Data Scientist teams to understand data requirements and provide data solutions. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Python and SQL and be eager to learn new skills and technologies.
   


    Responsibilities:
   



      Meet with internal stakeholders across various departments (Operations, Marketing, Finance, Sales, etc.) to address key business questions and problems.
     


      Collect, reality-check, and analyze data to address stakeholders’ key business questions. Interpret findings and present actionable insights, solutions, or recommendations while driving the implementation/adoption of them.
     


      Ensure the company wide KPI dashboard is updated and accurate as well as identify new metrics to be added.
     


      Identify areas of improvement for automating data collection, ingestion, and analysis.
     


      Be a self-starter with a proactive mindset of measuring and optimizing the way we operate the business.
     


      Collaborate cross functionally to ensure business and analytics data requirements are supported with robust, scalable, and adaptable data solutions.
     


      Ensure the best data management and governance practices in data quality, documentation, security, and privacy.
     


      Provide data and analytics support across the company.
     


      Other duties as assigned.
     



    Qualifications:
   



      Data driven mindset with a degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Engineering, or an equivalent technical field.
     


      1-3 years of hands-on experience in data analytics including data modeling, web/product analytics, marketing analytics, and data ETL/ELT pipeline documentation.
     


      A self-starter with a proactive mindset of measuring and optimizing business metrics/KPIs using Tableau or Excel.
     


      Experience with Python and SQL.
     


      Ability to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights.
     


      Strong understanding of statistical analysis, forecasting, and modeling.
     


      Exceptional ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbal and written, to influence cross-functional stakeholders.
     


      Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly improving, start-up environment that focuses on solving problems with iterative technical solutions.
     



    Nice to have:
   



      While not a hard requirement, experience with crypto based products and services or Ethereum and the crypto markets is a plus.
     


      Experience with A/B testing and other experimentation methods.
     


      Experience working for a rapidly growing startup, and managing change.
     


      Experience with Google Ads/B2C businesses.
     



    Working at CoinFlip means collaborating with experienced and innovative leaders who share a clear vision and a track record of success. We offer a collaborative and positive working environment where we encourage employees to balance productivity with time to recharge. Compensation is above and beyond a typical “startup” — we offer competitive salaries, performance-based incentives, and competitive benefits for full-time employees.
   


    CoinFlip values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Overview: 
 
  The Department of Veterans Affairs Network Operations Center (NOC) defends, manages, and monitors the network operating status and cyber security posture of the VA by providing the day-to-day management, monitoring, operations, and configuration of the Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) Gateways, the delivery of enterprise security systems and services, the conduct of threat and vulnerability analysis, the validation of adequate security controls within the enterprise, and the full range of functions across the spectrum of activities relating to incident management, incident response and enterprise network management.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Data Analyst Team: responsible for supporting, maintaining and, managing the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Enterprise Wide Area Network (WAN) through Capacity Management and Planning, Circuit Provisioning requests, Invoice reviews, and Mobility Services.
Responsible for maintaining and managing the Enterprise WAN (2500+ sites) by analyzing and reporting on circuit utilization to forecast/project WAN growth for the enterprise.
Participate in the review and analysis of existing network configurations in support of engineering to ensure that existing network methodologies and processes are compliant with One VA Enterprise Architecture (EA) requirements.
Contribute to the planning, tracking and analysis of multiple projects through reporting detailed information, analyzing data in support of project cost/schedule status and following established procedures while contributing to the completion of circuit provisioning requests.
Responsible for reviewing the enterprise invoices for multiple vendors to verify monthly costs, identify and initiate disputes, and make payment recommendations on purchase orders.
Support the VA Mobility Team by facilitating order requests, managing return request agreements, directing emergency requests to the correct contacts, and preparing status reports for vendors.
Will directly communicate with Project Managers, Contract Management staff, Senior Engineering/Technical personnel, as well as other VA employees.
Manage specified project objectives, project constraints (scope, schedule, cost, quality, etc.), project risk, and coordinate with project manager and other resources as needed.
Assist with the development of standard operating procedures to establish compliance with the operational practices of the organization.
Knowledge/experience with Microsoft Power BI data analytics tool
 Qualifications: 
 
Bachelor's with 2 - 5 years (or commensurate experience)
Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Background Investigation

Title: Research Analyst
Position Type: Contract; 1 Yr, may determine extension
Location: On-Site and Field
POSITION SUMMARY 
The Research Analyst will support a partnership of organizations whose goal is to conduct research, construct a survey and analyze data to drive effective outcomes and recommendations. The Research Analyst will conduct research, analyze results and present research in addition to gathering existing research and data. Interact with surveyees, draft documentation and analysis through data learning, produce data discoveries, and deliver statuses; all of which will drive to a common goal and vision.
Duties and Responsibilities:

Manage research projects from conception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget
Identify research methodologies, data collection techniques and analysis methods that will inform the team to ask deeper questions that strengthen the project
Determine areas of research to increase knowledge in a particular field and present research results to leadership
Assist in the design, curation, architecture, securing, formatting and analysis of data
Lead data gathering from various sources, including institutional data and surveys
Utilize a strong working knowledge in gathering, resourcing and analysis of data
Ability to present complex information in an accessible and organized manner
Plan and lead executive level and collaborator meetings and work sessions
Interpret data, produce reports discussing research findings and provide recommendations
Collaborate with higher education institutions and community organizations
Travel to, attend and conduct research and surveying events in three county region
Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Excellent communication skills (bilingual) in English and Spanish, written and verbal.
Legal to work in US without sponsorship
Valid driver’s license, insurance and own transportation (not public) as local travel (county regional) is required.

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor's, Master's degree or graduate work in Research, Mathematics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
One or more years of relevant research experience
Proven knowledge of data collection methods and working in data, analytics, visualization and informational storytelling
Proficiency or working knowledge in data analytics tools and statistical applications
Ability to present complex data clearly and effectively to varying audiences
Knowledge of project management
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders and build consensus.
Comfortable working with participants in the field
Passion for educational equity and empowerment
Commitment to social justice objectives

Preferred Skills:

Experience working in non-profit organizations or community-based programs

Physical Demands:
While performing duties of this position, the employee is frequently required to sit, stand and operate machinery. The employee will need to stand, walk, climb stairs, push or carry items weighing approximately 25 pounds. On rare occasions, the employee will need to reach above the shoulders and bend at the waist, or work while bent at the waist, kneel, stoop, crouch or squat and lift times. The employee will drive to and attend events in various locations throughout Snohomish, King and Pierce counties.
Working Conditions: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. While driving to or performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts, fumes or airborne particles. The employee is frequently exposed to vibration.
